items.headline: Our two daughters are struggling with student debt. Should we dip into our $1.8 million 401(k)s to buy them apartments?
items.summary_en: “Each apartment would be priced close to $225,000.”

items.headline: I received an inheritance from my father’s estate, but the executor wants me to give it back. What should I do?
items.summary_en: “The attorney for my late father stated that all beneficiaries needed to wait 10 months before disbursements from the sale of the home could be released.”

items.headline: The blistering AMD stock rally just culminated in a milestone
items.summary_en: Advanced Micro Devices shares have more than doubled this year, and the company joined the $400 billion market-cap club at Friday’s close.

items.headline: IBM’s stock has its best day since January, and quantum is a big reason why
items.summary_en: A soon-to-be-published IBM paper discusses progress made in the realm of quantum error correction when using an AMD chip.

items.headline: Social Security’s COLA will be 2.8% in 2026 — but prices are now rising faster than that
items.summary_en: Social Security’s cost-of-living adjustment will be 2.8% in 2026, up from 2.5% this year, the Social Security Administration said on Friday.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘Big Brother is watching how we spend our dollars’: I asked to withdraw money from my bank. The teller started grilling me. Is this normal?
items.summary_en: “We are going on a trip that could include casino visits, but I didn’t want her to know that.”

items.headline: Why Ford is doubling down on the F-150 — and redeploying EV workers
items.summary_en: Ford is adding extra workers and taking other measures to meet “strong” customer demand for its F-Series pickup trucks, while making up for production losses stemming from a fire at an aluminum supplier’s plant.

items.headline: I’m a veteran, 57, and on disability benefits. How do I persuade my wife, 52, to downsize so we can both retire?
items.summary_en: “I am now medically disabled/retired and receive $2,100 a month from Social Security.”

items.headline: Why Nov. 1 is a make-or-break day for millions of Americans’ finances
items.summary_en: If the government shutdown stretches beyond October, experts warn that Nov. 1 could mark a grim cutoff for low- and middle-income families.
